pull.title: Improved efficiency in constructors of COutPoint
pull.body: the default constructor was executing memset(0) twice, first in uint256 default constructor and later in the call to SetNull.

events.body: Looks good to me. But is there a reason to move the implementation away from the header?
Agree with @jonasschnelli. I expect that removing the ability to inline the constructor will have a worse effect than the double memset had.
I had no strong reason to move the impl, I moved it back to the header..
squashed, any further action required from my side?, thanks
@mm-s Your squashing has introduced unrelated commits. Can please remove them, as well as the merge commit.

Still needs a rebase, maybe try this?:

git fetch bitcoin
git merge bitcoin master
git reset --soft bitcoin/master
git commit -m ' Improved efficiency in constructors of COutPoint'
git push origin master -f
